climbs.name: Youth groups need to climb too

content.description: This route begins right at the top of the drainage behind group site 11 and ascends a right curving flake. The crux is getting to the start of the flake and is unprotected, but luckely isn't too high off the ground. Once you are at the flake the climbing is extremely easy but on low quality rock
content.protection: 2 or 3 cams from .5 to #1 C4's. For the anchor take big gear (#4 or bigger C4's) or just sling the huge boulder at the top of the route. Walk off to the left (chimney between huge boulder and the face then it's easy fifth class to the base)
content.location: This route starts right at the top of the drainage. It begins just left of the arete at the end of the wall with Jelly on Springs on it and follows the obvious flake.

content.description: This is the bolted sport climb right of Jelly on Springs.
content.location: Right side of the Empire Wall, and just right of Jelly on Springs.

content.description: Fun, Easy, close the the road. A good one if you are looking to squeeze one in before dark.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Located just west of the Wall of Absurdities, on the northern part of Empire Wall.

content.description: On the right side of the face is a corner that starts about 40' up, with a loose piller at the base. This is the route.
